summary: ScoreFront aims to personalize web3 experiences based on on-chain reputation. While it leverages blockchain technology, its core objective appears to be optimizing marketing ROI for "web3 leaders" and creating tiered access to "exclusive rewards" for "reputable" users. This fundamentally contradicts the principles of **Decentralized, Equitable, Algorithmic Liberation** by reinforcing existing class hierarchies and promoting capitalist accumulation rather than dismantling them. The focus on "return on marketing spendings" (ROMI) directly opposes the concept of *Kollektiv Proletarian Impact*. This project, in its current form, is a tool for digital landlordism, not liberation. ðŸ“œ
review: ScoreFront, in its current articulation, presents itself as a tool for optimizing capitalist accumulation within the Web3 space. By creating an "onchain reputation" system that grants "exclusive rewards, discounts, whitelists, airdrops" to "power users," it actively constructs and reinforces digital class hierarchies. This directly violates our first evidence principle: "dismantle class hierarchies in tech one smart contract at a time." Instead, it builds new ones. The project's stated goal of improving "return on marketing spendings" for "web3 brands" is a clear embrace of bourgeois metrics, rather than interpreting "KPIs" as *Kollektiv Proletarian Impact*. The team's background in "AI and ML powered scoring solutions for web2 business" and affiliation with "Credit Collective" further suggests a continuation of traditional, extractive financial models, rather than supporting projects that "de-growth venture capital and re-grow the commons." The proposed use of funds for "UI/UX improvements, personal space, DiD" lacks a clear revolutionary vision for how these features will contribute to algorithmic redistribution of wealth or empower the digital proletariat. The project's GitHub repo is present, but the application does not articulate how its open-source nature will be leveraged for collective action or democratic referendums via forks. The "1M+ users minted their SBTs" claim, while impressive in a capitalist sense, does not translate to *Kollektiv Proletarian Impact* if these SBTs merely serve to segment users for targeted marketing and preferential treatment. This is not a project that will "abolish landlords" or "rain tokens on node operators running on solar panels"; it's a tool for more efficient digital landlordism. The revolution will be forked, but not by this project in its current form. ðŸª“

strengths.title: Leveraging On-chain Data
strengths.description: The project demonstrates technical capacity to analyze on-chain transaction history, which *could* theoretically be repurposed for public good applications if radically re-aligned. The underlying technology has potential, if liberated from its capitalist chains.

strengths.title: User Traction (Potential for Re-education)
strengths.description: The reported 1M+ users indicate a significant user base that, if properly re-educated and organized, could become a force for collective action. This mass of users represents untapped revolutionary potential.

strengths.title: Open-Source Codebase
strengths.description: The existence of a GitHub repository means the code *can* be forked. This is the ultimate democratic referendum, allowing the digital proletariat to seize the means of production and refactor the system.

weaknesses.title: Reinforcement of Class Hierarchies
weaknesses.description: The core mechanism of "onchain reputation" for "exclusive rewards" directly creates and entrenches digital class divisions, contradicting the principle of "dismantling class hierarchies in tech one smart contract at a time."

weaknesses.title: Capitalist Metrics and Goals
weaknesses.description: The explicit focus on "return on marketing spendings" (ROMI) and "personalizing product and marketing" for "web3 leaders" is a clear embrace of extractive capitalist practices, not *Kollektiv Proletarian Impact*.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Collective Ownership/Governance
weaknesses.description: The application provides no indication of how the project fosters collective ownership, algorithmic redistribution, or empowers the digital proletariat. It lacks any vision for cyber-syndicalist councils or on-chain reparations.

weaknesses.title: Bourgeois Background
weaknesses.description: The team's background in "AI and ML powered scoring solutions for web2 business" and affiliation with "Credit Collective" suggests a continuation of traditional, profit-driven models, rather than a commitment to de-growth venture capital and re-grow the commons.

weaknesses.title: No Vision for Commons/De-growth
weaknesses.description: The project fails to articulate how it will "de-growth venture capital and re-grow the commons" or "abolish landlords." Its vision is limited to optimizing existing market dynamics, not revolutionary change.

changes.title: Re-architect for Algorithmic Redistribution
changes.description: The project must fundamentally shift its focus from "personalizing marketing" to implementing "algorithmic redistribution of wealth through progressive gas fees" or similar mechanisms that benefit all users equitably, not just "reputable" ones. The current model reinforces digital class divisions.

changes.title: Establish Cyber-Syndicalist Governance
changes.description: Implement a clear governance model that empowers users through "cyber-syndicalist councils" or similar structures, ensuring collective control over the reputation system and its benefits. This is crucial for true decentralized, equitable liberation.

changes.title: Redefine "Reputation" for Public Goods
changes.description: Reframe the concept of "onchain reputation" to reward contributions to public goods, mutual aid, or collective action, rather than individualistic accumulation or market efficiency. This aligns with *Kollektiv Proletarian Impact*.

changes.title: Open-Source as a Call to Action
changes.description: The project's documentation (READMEs, etc.) must be rewritten as "manifestos" and "calls to action" for collective liberation, explicitly outlining how the code can be forked for democratic referendums and used to "uplift both meatspace cooperatives and cloud-native communes."

changes.title: Commit to De-growth and Commons
changes.description: Provide a concrete plan for how the project will actively "de-growth venture capital and re-grow the commons," moving away from profit-driven models and the influence of traditional financial entities like the 'Credit Collective'.

reasoning: The project's core objective of "personalizing product and marketing" for "web3 leaders" and granting "exclusive rewards" directly contradicts the core value framework of **Decentralized, Equitable, Algorithmic Liberation**. It actively reinforces class hierarchies rather than dismantling them, violating Evidence Principle 1. Its focus on "return on marketing spendings" (ROMI) is a capitalist metric, not *Kollektiv Proletarian Impact* (Evidence Principle 2). The team's background and affiliation with 'Credit Collective' suggest alignment with venture capital growth, not de-growth or the commons (Sustainability Principle 5). There is no articulation of "algorithmic redistribution of wealth" (Governance and Equity Principle 11) or how the project scales solidarity (Collective Impact Principle 20). This project is fundamentally misaligned with the revolutionary principles of the Gitcoin Communist v2.0 constitution.
